title: Drawing, Frame
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d and 457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. An oblong molded frame has in the middle on top and below panels. In the upper one are two circular medallions with structures. Above lie the keys and the tiara. From the keys hang a garland around the frame. In the panel below are two eight-pointed and two multi-pointed stars. Laterally are two medallions similar to those above. Colored background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Frame. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1905
